description: A medium-sized Amazon with primarily green plumage, a maroon forehead, and a distinctive lilac-blue crown and neck. They are known for their gentler nature.
temperament: Generally considered calmer, less aggressive, and quieter than many other Amazon species. They are playful, curious, and can be very affectionate.
loudness: Moderate. While capable of loud calls, they are not as prone to screaming as some of their relatives.
loudness_icon: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="w-12 h-12 text-yellow-500" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="currentColor" aria-hidden="true" role="img" aria-label="Moderate"><title>Moderate</title><path d="M7 9v6h4l5 5V4l-5 5H7zm9.5 2.5c0 .75-.38 1.41-.97 1.82v-3.64c.59.41.97 1.07.97 1.82zM14 8.25v7.5c1.18-.41 2-1.57 2-2.75s-.82-2.34-2-2.75z"></path></svg>
vocalization: Moderate talkers. They can develop a decent vocabulary but are not typically as prolific as the yellow-headed species.
dietaryNeeds: A well-balanced diet of high-quality pellets, fresh vegetables, and limited fruit to prevent obesity.
healthPointers: A generally hardy species with a lifespan of 50+ years. Prone to the common Amazon ailments like obesity and Vitamin A deficiency if not fed a proper diet.
housing: A good-sized cage is still needed. Minimum 30"W x 24"D x 40"H. Their more moderate noise level might make them more suitable for some shared-wall living situations than other Amazons.
